user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of iov_max_init_:
```c
static void
iov_max_init_ (void)
{
  long res = sysconf (_SC_IOV_MAX);
  if (res >= 0)
    mhd_iov_max_ = (unsigned long) res;
  else
  {
#if defined(IOV_MAX)
    mhd_iov_max_ = IOV_MAX;
#else  /* ! IOV_MAX */
    mhd_iov_max_ = 8; /* Should be the safe limit */
#endif /* ! IOV_MAX */
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function iov_max_init_:
static unsigned long mhd_iov_max_ = 0
...
void
MHD_send_init_static_vars_ (void)
{
#ifdef HAVE_FREEBSD_SENDFILE
  /* FreeBSD 11 and later allow to specify read-ahead size
   * and handles SF_NODISKIO differently.
   * SF_FLAGS defined only on FreeBSD 11 and later. */
#ifdef SF_FLAGS
  freebsd_sendfile_init_ ();
#endif /* SF_FLAGS */
#endif /* HAVE_FREEBSD_SENDFILE */
#if defined(HAVE_SYSCONF) && defined(_SC_IOV_MAX)
  iov_max_init_ ();
#endif /* HAVE_SYSCONF && _SC_IOV_MAX */
}
...
void
MHD_init (void)
{
#if defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  WSADATA wsd;
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */

  MHD_set_panic_func (NULL, NULL);

#if defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  if (0 != WSAStartup (MAKEWORD (2, 2), &wsd))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to initialize winsock.\n"));
  if ((2 != LOBYTE (wsd.wVersion)) && (2 != HIBYTE (wsd.wVersion)))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Winsock version 2.2 is not available.\n"));
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */
#ifdef HTTPS_SUPPORT
#ifdef MHD_HTTPS_REQUIRE_GCRYPT
#if GCRYPT_VERSION_NUMBER < 0x010600
#if GNUTLS_VERSION_NUMBER <= 0x020b00
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS)
  if (0 != gcry_control (GCRYCTL_SET_THREAD_CBS,
                         &gcry_threads_pthread))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to initialise multithreading in libgcrypt.\n"));
#elif defined(MHD_W32_MUTEX_)
  if (0 != gcry_control (GCRYCTL_SET_THREAD_CBS,
                         &gcry_threads_w32))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to initialise multithreading in libgcrypt.\n"));
#endif /* defined(MHD_W32_MUTEX_) */
#endif /* GNUTLS_VERSION_NUMBER <= 0x020b00 */
  gcry_check_version (NULL);
#else
  if (NULL == gcry_check_version ("1.6.0"))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("libgcrypt is too old. MHD was compiled for " \
                  "libgcrypt 1.6.0 or newer.\n"));
#endif
#endif /* MHD_HTTPS_REQUIRE_GCRYPT */
  gnutls_global_init ();
#endif /* HTTPS_SUPPORT */
  MHD_monotonic_sec_counter_init ();
  MHD_send_init_static_vars_ ();
  MHD_init_mem_pools_ ();
  /* Check whether sizes were correctly detected by configure */
#ifdef _DEBUG
  if (1)
  {
    struct timeval tv;
    mhd_assert (sizeof(tv.tv_sec) == SIZEOF_STRUCT_TIMEVAL_TV_SEC);
  }
#endif /* _DEBUG */
  mhd_assert (sizeof(uint64_t) == SIZEOF_UINT64_T);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I selected the static function iov_max_init_ and its guarded invocation because iov_max_init_ is declared static (file scope) and the only visible call in this translation unit is under a preprocessor condition. If HAVE_SYSCONF and/or _SC_IOV_MAX are not defined when compiling this file, the call is removed and the static function becomes unreachable (no external linkage to call it), which should be investigated for possible dead/unreachable code. The conditional compilation around the call is the key fragment to check.

I also flagged the "if (1)" block under _DEBUG because the condition is a compile-time constant and may indicate redundant or debug-only code; constant conditions often lead to unreachable branches elsewhere or may reflect leftover code and thus warrant review under Rule 2.1.

Other fragments in the supplied code were not flagged because they do not present obvious unreachable code: the runtime branch inside iov_max_init_ (if (res >= 0) / else) is determined at run-time and both branches are potentially reachable; the preprocessor branches (e.g. IOV_MAX vs fallback 8) remove code at compile time but are not C-language unreachable code within the compiled unit; the other #ifdef/#if nested blocks in MHD_init and MHD_send_init_static_vars_ control inclusion based on configuration macros but do not themselves produce C-level unreachable statements in the compiled output (they either include valid code or omit it). Therefore they are not reported as suspicious for Rule 2.1 based on the provided snippets.
